data.title: Twice As Hard
data.text:
1990 single by The Black Crowes

"Twice As Hard" is a song by the American southern rock band The Black Crowes. From on their first album, Shake Your Money Maker, the song was released as a single in 1990 and reached the 11th position in the Mainstream Rock charts.

A music video directed by Pete Angelus was shot in 1990 to promote the single. It features the band playing the song at night in a mansion. The band is also shown having a daytime lunch during the guitar solo.[1]

In addition to being the first track on Shake Your Money Maker, "Twice As Hard" is also included on the Crowes' Greatest Hits 1990â€“1999: A Tribute to a Work in Progress greatest hits compilation. The song is in the key of G major.

In other media

[edit]

In 1998 the song was performed on the Jools Holland show with Kelly Jones of the Stereophonics.[2]

"Twice As Hard" is used in the movies Mad Dog and Glory[3] and Ladder 49.[4]
